definition: Castro (name)/Fidel Castro or Fidel Alejandro Castro Ruz (1926-), Cuban revolutionary leader, prime minister 1959-1976, president 1976-2008
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: How many times do you believe that Fidel Castro has tried to kill you?
sentences.chinese: 那你知道菲德爾卡斯特羅有多少次試圖謀殺你嗎？

sentences.english: What may count for more is that Mr Castro is increasingly preoccupied by his legacy.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是卡斯特羅越來越關心他的身後事。

sentences.english: Castro chats with one of his men.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅與他的一名男隊員聊天。

sentences.english: Castelnuovo-Tedesco also composed for them a Concerto for Two Guitars.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅夫還爲他們寫了一首雙吉他協奏曲。

sentences.english: The foreign minister did not say when Castro will return.
sentences.chinese: 外交管並沒有說卡斯特羅何時來歸。

sentences.english: I like Rosalia de Castro (1837~1885), Castro sovietized Cuba.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅將古巴蘇維埃化。

sentences.english: This Maduro is following Castro's governing blueprint.
sentences.chinese: 馬杜羅跟隨的是卡斯特羅的統治藍圖。

sentences.english: In fact, castro has insight into her everything.
sentences.chinese: 其實，卡斯特羅早已洞察了她的一切。

sentences.english: The finale of the festival is the short film competition at the Castro.
sentences.chinese: 本次電影節的終曲是卡斯特羅的短片賽。

sentences.english: Fidel Castro is the most iconic figure we have in the world.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅是世界上最值得崇拜的人物。

sentences.english: On the evening that day, President Hu attended the grand welcome banquet hosted by Castro.
sentences.chinese: 當晚，胡錦濤出席了卡斯特羅舉行的盛大歡迎宴會。

sentences.english: You've got... the Castro has a really large gay community,
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅區，有一個很大的同性戀者社區。

sentences.english: Castro was to be arraigned today, and is to face a capital murder charge.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅是今天被提審，並面臨死刑的謀殺罪指控。

sentences.english: Mr. Castro also fostered a close alliance with the Soviet Union -- a move that alienated the United States.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯特羅還與蘇聯結成密切聯盟，此舉疏遠了美國。

sentences.english: I remember when Castro came into power andpeople started leaving Cuba, manyof them came to NJ.
sentences.chinese: 我記得當時卡斯特羅上臺時，很多人開始離開古巴。

definition: Snow (name)/Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China
François Hollande (1954-), French Socialist politician, president of France 2012-2017
Bernard Montgomery (Montie) (1887-1976), Second World War British field marshal/Montgomery or Montgomerie (surname)
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
